CreditLine: Bequest of Mrs. Jean M. Riddell, 2010
Description: This teapot is exceptionally rich in its range of colors and decorative floral motifs. Around the bulbous body of the pot, there are six raised lobes each decorated with a painted with a scene that is repeated on both sides: an exuberantly exotic bird; a seventeenth-century falconer with his falcon; and a deer. On the side and front faces of the spout appear storks. The handle is in raised leaf and floral decoration and terminates in a dolphin's or dragon's head.

Medium: silver gilding, painted and filigree enamel, ivory
Provenance: Leo Kaplan, New York; Jean M. Riddell, Washington, D.C., November 19, 1977, by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 2010, by bequest.
Title: Teapot
